definition: old name for Shanghai 上海[Shang4 hai3]/surname Shen
to extend/to state/to explain/9th earthly branch: 3-5 p.m., 7th solar month (7th August-7th September), year of the Monkey/ancient Chinese compass point: 240°
to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
to uphold (e.g. justice or virtue)/to promote

pinyin: shen1 shou3 bu4 jian4 wu3 zhi3

definition: to stretch oneself (on waking or when tired etc)
to right wrongs/to redress an injustice

sentences.english: Just reach into the powder and pull out your wrench.
sentences.chinese: 把手伸到粉末裏把你的扳手拿出來。

sentences.english: The quiet streets stretched out on either side like the arms of a skeleton.
sentences.chinese: 靜靜的街道從兩旁伸出來，像骷髏伸着枯臂。

sentences.english: They threw their hands in the air.
sentences.chinese: 他們把手放開伸在空中。

sentences.english: When the tide rises, the seawater reaches around our house.
sentences.chinese: 漲潮時，海水伸到我們的住宅周圍。

sentences.english: Iron and iron baluster between, only can hold the monkey arm outstretched.
sentences.chinese: 鐵欄杆與鐵欄杆之間，僅能容得下猴子的手臂伸出來。

sentences.english: The contents of the pan began to boil, and he turned to plunge his hand into the bowl;
sentences.chinese: 鍋裏的東西開始燒滾了，他轉過來把手朝盆裏伸。

sentences.english: Do not reach across one guest to serve another.
sentences.chinese: 不要從一個客人身旁伸過手去服務另一位客人。

sentences.english: The man reached again into his pocket for the matches.
sentences.chinese: 他又把手伸到口袋裏面去掏火柴。

sentences.english: Tongue lolling, the dog came lolloping back from the forest.
sentences.chinese: 那隻狗伸着舌頭從樹林裏蹣跚地跑回來。

sentences.english: And Shaharaim begat children in the country of Moab, after he had sent them away; Hushim and Baara were his wives.
sentences.chinese: 沙哈連休他二妻戶伸和巴拉之後，在摩押地生了兒子。

sentences.english: Stick out the tongue and blow it by a hair dryer.
sentences.chinese: 把舌頭伸出來用吹風筒吹乾。

sentences.english: I stretched out my left out, and on the palm I saw that there was a tiny exquisite kingfisher.
sentences.chinese: 我伸着左掌，掌上立着一隻極其纖小的翠鳥。

sentences.english: After 3~6 months' dirigation the survived fingers could stretch or crook freely.
sentences.chinese: 成活的手指經3至6月功能鍛鍊，手指屆伸優良。

sentences.english: Can we extend the legs of this dining table?
sentences.chinese: 我們能把餐桌的桌腿伸展開嗎。

sentences.english: Having finished their morning work the clerks stood up behind their desks stretching themselves.
sentences.chinese: 玩成了早間工作之後，職員們站到桌子後面伸伸懶腰。

definition: to stretch oneself (on waking or when tired etc)
to reach out with one's hand/to hold out a hand/(fig.) to beg/to get involved/to meddle
to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
to pull/to stretch/to draw sth out
